Macros
Command Codes
I2C Control command and status codes

Macros

#define I2C_CMD_LOOPBACK   0
 Command code used by I2C_control() to place I2C in loopback mode. More...
 
#define I2C_CMD_ADDR_MODE   1
 Command code used by I2C_control() to choose the addressing mode. More...
 
#define I2C_CMD_I2COAR   2
 Command code used by I2C_control() to configure I2C own address. More...
 

Detailed Description

I2C_CMD_* macros are general command codes for I2C_control(). Not all I2C driver implementations support these command codes.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I2C_CMD_ADDR_MODE   1

Command code used by I2C_control() to choose the addressing mode.

This command is available to choose the addressing mode in the I2C Driver. With this command code, arg is a pointer to an integer. *arg contains the status of the address mode. 1 will set the mode to 10-bit addressing mode. 0 will set the mode to 7-bit addressing mode.

Note: When set to 1, I2C master driver doesnot support combined formats.

#define I2C_CMD_I2COAR   2

Command code used by I2C_control() to configure I2C own address.

This command is available to configure I2C own address. With this command code, arg is a pointer to an integer.

Note: The addressing mode must be set before configuring I2C own address.

#define I2C_CMD_LOOPBACK   0

Command code used by I2C_control() to place I2C in loopback mode.

This command is available to place the I2C Driver in loopback mode. This is a debug only feature. With this command code, arg is a pointer to an integer. *arg contains the status of the loopback. 1 will enable the loopback and 0 will disable it
